title: US House passes three bills on China human rights, Asia-Pacific cooperation
description: One piece of legislation authorises further action to protect Uygur population, while another would help counter Beijing’s disinformation about Tibet.

title: Palau’s president raises threat of pivot to Beijing if US funds are delayed further
description: In letter to US senator, President Surangel Whipps Jnr writes that local leaders want to gain more financial aid from Beijing ‘at the cost of shifting alliances, beginning with sacrificing Taiwan’.

title: As Chinese scramble to save money, ‘everyone realises winter has come’, and they’re trying to get out of the cold
description: Gone are the days when the property and stock markets yielded guaranteed gains in China, leading to middle-class investors becoming more risk-averse with their hard-earned savings and familial wealth.

title: Global South shows it’s ready to challenge unfair US-led world order
description: The recent G77 summit calling for global governance reform and South Africa’s ICJ genocide case against Israel underline developing nations’ distaste for – and willingness to act against – the Western-centric global order.

title: Leaving China, long-time EU trade group chief says investors remain keen, but with more reservations
description: Multinationals still want to invest, Joerg Wuttke, president emeritus of the European Union Chamber of Commerce in China, says, but obstacles include overcapacity in manufacturing and a lack of candour from top leadership.

title: China warns nationals holidaying in Bali to mind safety risks after ‘accidents involving Chinese tourists’
description: Consulate-General in Denpasar in WeChat post tells Chinese nationals not to ride scooters without a licence, and to mind the risks on hilly roads and in the water, but deletes reference to fatal accidents within hours.

title: China is opening up visa-free rules for Europe and Asia. Why have Japan and the UK not made the cut?
description: Exclusion of economic powerhouses Japan and Britain shows China remains mindful of geopolitical considerations even as it seeks to boost post-Covid economy, observers say.

title: Chinese tourists visiting popular island resort Hainan caught out by return ticket shortages amid Lunar New Year travel rush
description: Air authorities look to lay on more flights as travellers who visited the tropical island on a whim find themselves caught out by lack of tickets.

title: China’s stock market has little to fear from Trump presidency – unlike the US
description: While Donald Trump has taken credit for the fall in Chinese stocks, the truth is that domestic, not external, factors are at play in China. Instead, the focus should be on Trump’s threat to US democracy, the rule of law and the credibility of American economic policy should he be re-elected.

title: China’s Wang Yi to champion ‘equal and orderly multipolar world’ at Munich Security Conference
description: Top diplomat Wang Yi to take part in annual conference in Germany, dubbed ‘Davos for defence’, which is likely to address wars in Middle East and Ukraine. While in Europe, the Chinese foreign minister will also visit Spain and France.

title: To curb Lunar New Year economic lull, Shanghai hires planes, trains and automobiles to bring workers back
description: The weeklong holiday makes it more difficult to maintain production levels as cities and provinces are being hard-pressed to rev up China’s economic engine, driving up competition for labour resources.

title: Apple’s Vision Pro raises interest for extended reality technology, spurring broader demand for more affordable headsets, Rokid CEO says
description: Rokid chief executive Misa Zhu Mingming said Apple’s Vision Pro headset is expected to spur broader demand for more affordable and ergonomically designed AR and VR wearable devices.

title: Chinese team tests lung treatment that may be first to reverse damage from chronic disease affecting 700 million people
description: Paper follows statement by Zuo Wei that ‘stem cell and progenitor cell-based regenerative medicine may be the biggest, if not the only, hope to cure COPD’.

title: China-Australia relations: Treasury Wine readies to ship Penfolds, Icon bottles once Beijing lifts import tariffs
description: China is conducting a review into its tariffs on Australian wine, and expectations are rife that levies will be removed next month, with Treasury Wine Estates planning to reallocate stock from other global markets.

title: US-China tech war: Dutch chip tool giant ASML says geopolitics, new export curbs remain risks
description: The firm says it faces new competition from rival companies ‘driven by the ambition of self-sufficiency in the geopolitical context’.

title: In battered Chinese stocks, traders favour ‘lottery ticket’ trade
description: In the wreckage of China’s stock-market meltdown, Wall Street traders are making long-shot bets that officials in Beijing can stoke a recovery.

title: China’s youth ‘lie flat’ as economy slows, with ‘free time worth more than several thousand yuan’
description: China’s youth jobless rate rose to a record high in June amid an economy still struggling to return to pre-pandemic growth levels, with some now working just enough to afford to spend their time on what they enjoy.

title: China’s Lunar New Year fireworks: even a beloved tradition can’t ignore public safety
description: The debate over the ban on setting off fireworks and firecrackers to celebrate the new year arises anew every time the festival comes around. A balance should be struck, and local governments have the leeway to set regulations appropriate to the situation.

title: Thinking of adding an emoji as you text? Think again, say researchers in Britain, as context matters
description: Age, cultural background and gender can influence the way people interpret emojis, University of Nottingham researchers say in study of British and Chinese adults published in PLOS ONE journal.
